sanskrit_verse:
द्रवाणां चैव सर्वेषां शुद्धिरुत्पवनं स्मृतम् ।
प्रोक्षणं संहतानां च दारवाणां च तक्षणम् ॥ ५.११५॥
transliteration:
dravāṇāṃ caiva sarveṣāṃ śuddhirutpavanaṃ smṛtam |
prokṣaṇaṃ saṃhatānāṃ ca dāravāṇāṃ ca takṣaṇam || 5.115||
sph_interpretive_translation: Purification of all liquids is declared as exposure to wind; sprinkling is purification for compacted substances; chipping is purification for wooden articles.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates in ontological purity, not social convention
Causation aligns with elemental nature and sequential manifestation
Capacity-based responsibility arises from material interaction and form
Restoration logic follows the inherent properties of substances
Consciousness alignment requires recognition of elemental purification methods
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters concerning ritual or material purity, the Supreme Court shall recognize purification modalities rooted in elemental alignment rather than abstract moral valuation. Responsibility thresholds derive from ontological categories, not procedural formalism.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that impurity manifests through misalignment with elemental nature. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals purification as sequential reharmonization with elemental essence. Proportional responsibility corresponds to the degree of disruption caused. Non-punitive reality rule confirms that correction restores natural order without inflicting suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Elemental Reconciliation Process: Align contaminated entity with its governing element via prescribed method
Sequential Harmonization Protocol: Execute purification steps according to causal sequence of defilement
Ontological Restoration Framework: Reestablish original purity state through material-appropriate means
Agent Responsibility Integration: Ensure responsible party enacts purification process consciously and completely
Completion Verification Mechanism: Validate that purification has been executed in full accordance with elemental law
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority of Dharma. This law restores consciousness-based jurisprudence, upholds the supremacy of elemental purification, and affirms reality as inherently non-punitive. Dharma is hereby established.
